intro: Maytenus obtusifolia var. ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaf mayten, is a species of flowering plant in the family Celastraceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its ovate, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. The wood of this species is hard and durable, making it valuable for traditional uses.
